intro: Toussaintia patriciae, commonly known as the Paterson's curse, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and blue to purple flowers. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Due to its invasive nature in some regions, it is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
